Hardware

In the future according to Moore’s Law we with have computer with many cores. Today (2022) we have for instance a MacBook with 8 Cores1. If every two the size doubles. Then we have in 10 years 256 cores and in 20 years 8192 cores. But in 40 years we break wall with an order of 1 million cores in a cpu.

   Now                      
    8, 16, 32, 64, 128, 256 Cores (Now+10 years)
    256, 512, 1024, 2048, 4096, 8192 Cores (Now+20 years)

For these new very fast computers we need a different ways of programming2.

New

A computer with let says 100.000 smalls little simple processors with its own core memory.

You can programm each small processors and you can connect the output to input of other processors. While data is flowing from one “i/o cell” to the next.

  IN --> [fn(x)(+ x 1)] --> [fn(x y)(+ x y)] --> OUT

RISC

I should be a small fast, maybe a RISC architectire like MMIX3.

  2. “The Hundred-Year Language” - Paul Graham ↩

  3. “MMIX - A RISC Computer for the 3rd Millennium” - Donald Knuth ↩
